definition[0]: to put or hold something in a position so that it cannot move
example[0]: She clamped her hands over her ears.
example[1]: Creed opened his mouth to speak, then clamped it shut.
definition[1]: to hold two things together using a clamp
example[2]: Clamp the two parts together until the glue dries.
definition[2]: to put a clamp on the wheel of a car so that the car cannot be driven away. This is usually done because the car is illegally parked
example[3]: He returned, only to discover his car had been clamped.
explanation[0]: Clamp is usually passive in this meaning
definition[3]: a piece of equipment for holding things together
definition[4]: a metal object that is fastened to the wheel of a car so that the car cannot be driven away. This is usually done because the car is illegally parked
